item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It was just that he was fun in such an exhausting way because, being in advertising, he always wanted you to know how much fun he was having and where he had got his jacket from." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Frédéric Beigbeder
item.description: "Love hasn't got anything to do with the heart, the heart's a disgusting organ, a sort of pump full of blood. Love is primarily concerned with the lungs. People shouldn't say "she's broken my heart" but "she's stifled my lungs." Lungs are the most romantic organs: lovers and artists always contract tuberculosis. It's not a coincidence that Chekhov, Kafka, D.H. Lawrence, Chopin, George Orwell and St Thérèse of Lisieux all died of it; as for Camus, Moravia, Boudard and Katherine Mansfield, would they have written the same books if it werent for TB?" -- Frédéric Beigbeder

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "After the bare requisites to living and reproducing, man wants most to leave some record of himself, a proof, perhaps, that he has really existed. He leaves his proof on wood, on stone or on the lives of other people. This deep desire exists in everyone, from the boy who writes dirty words in a public toilet to the Buddha who etches his image in the race mind. Life is so unreal. I think that we seriously doubt that we exist and go about trying to prove that we do." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle; Corrections And Editor Edgar W. Smith; Illustrators
item.description: "The world is full of obvious things which nobody by any chance ever observes." -- Arthur Conan Doyle; Corrections And Editor Edgar W. Smith; Illustrators

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "It is not down on any map; true places never are." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by James Weldon Johnson
item.description: "And God stepped out on space, and He looked around and said: I'm lonely - I'll make me a world." -- James Weldon Johnson

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Cesare Pavese
item.description: "Traveling is a brutality. It forces you to trust strangers and to lose sight of all that familiar comfort of home and friends. You are constantly off balance. Nothing is yours except the essential things: air, sleep, dreams, sea, the sky - all things tending towards the eternal or what we imagine of it." -- Cesare Pavese

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Voltaire
item.description:
"I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: Oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it."
(<i>Letter to Étienne Noël Damilaville</i>, May 16, 1767)" -- Voltaire

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well..." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "All good things are wild and free." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Richard Curtis
item.description: "Cause if you shoot a bullet someone dies. If you drop a bomb many die. You hit a woman, love dies. But if you say the F-word... nothing actually happens." -- Richard Curtis

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by John Prine
item.description: "Jesus was a good guy, he didn't need this shit." -- John Prine
